On both planets almost everything was normal for the inhabitants. Well except for one planet, strange portals appeared everywhere. Curious inhabitants approached these portals and a few even entered the portals. With a loud whoosh the inhabitants found themselves moving at high speed to a distant planet. On the distant planet whose day until then had been normal portals began to appear. Bizarrely the portals opened and exited in similar areas (desert to desert, jungle to jungle etc.) Much to the terror of the inhabitants on the exiting side was the giant animals coming out of the portals. To the 'giants' they were confused at their now shrunken surroundings.

So the fun begins and where in the 'small' world are we?

She had noticed the small humans made a shrieking noise when a creature smashed into their homes or crushed them under paw. By placing their new burrow in the middle of the human's hive, they surrounded themselves with the humans structures. This meant if another creature was trying to sneak up and attack the Hyenas, the human's cries would alert the clan of the danger. For example, if a Lion decided to sneak up on their burrow, they would hear the humans cry out as they were crushed under the Lions paws. This would alert the group to the invaders presence, allowing them to counter attack. Humans, while not very smart, were sure useful, she thought to herself.

Although, the female suddenly thought of an issue with her plan. These small insect creatures seem easily spooked and like to flee, even if it means into danger (or a hungry Hyena maw). Digging the den is sure to kill countless humans. What if that causes them all to run away from this hive and start another elsewhere? The Matriarch wouldn't stand for that! She decided to work on fixing this problem, leaving the males to continue digging the burrow. Her plan to stop the humans from escaping the city is:
142332112221121211.title: Hyenas moving in!

choices: She notices an airport, the humans can fly away!
1423321122211212111.content:
The female began to casually stroll away from the males, leaving them to their work. She opted to walk along a different "path" in between the human structures, which led to a fresh part of the city. The Hyena found the roadways quite convenient, compared to slogging through the buildings. "These trails must have been carved out by the past animals that fed on these creatures", she thought to herself.

Despite walking along a road and taking a less destructive route then the males, the female still left quite an "impact" on the city. Road surfaces shattered, building's facades cracked and hundreds of cars as well as humans were flattened. Surprisingly, she wanted to keep the damage to the humans somewhat minimal, since they would be serving as the clans food source. But the destruction caused by simply walking around couldn't be helped, the humans would just have to deal with it. "These creatures probably won't take long to adjust to our presence" she said to herself, casually slicing an apartment building in half with her tail as she continued on her way.

It took quite a bit of walking, but the female finally noticed that the size and frequency of the human mounds were becoming smaller and fewer, giving way to more natural looking plant life and rock. She stopped and sat down, surveying the area. She had traversed to the outskirts of the city. Looking back, the Hyena could see smoke rising from her destruction, clearly marking the path she took. The paw prints the female left were very deep, rendering the entire road completely unusable for the humans. She could also just barely see the raised behinds of the three male Hyenas, still digging out the den in the cities core. A massive skyscraper near them suddenly started to crumble and collapse, killing hundreds and burying more. This was no doubt a result of the males somewhat messy antics. "Oh well, at least the den will be completed by tonight", she thought to herself. The female casually dismissed the destruction, they couldn't live without a den!

The Hyena then looks to her side, seeing many different paths leading out of the city. She would need to somehow block these paths to prevent the humans from escaping. The female hadn't seen any humans with wings when she was gobbling them down, so she wouldn't have to worry about them "flying away". Looking at the nearest path, she could see it was full of those small colorful crunchy objects that seemed to litter the pathways. Except this time they were on the move! The highway ahead of her was packed with vehicles trying to evacuate the city, just as she had predicted. The female let out a giggle, how dare they try to escape! She raced over to the motorway, destroying all in her wake.

The people on the road were desperate. They had seen and felt the destruction happening to their beloved city, and were fleeing for their lives. Suddenly, they felt the ground shake. The vibrations caused multiple cars to lose control, colliding with each other. The female Hyena leaped, diving her front paws onto the motorway. She instantly crushed multiple vehicles and their drivers. She continued to stomp the escapees mercilessly, growling as if trying to say "Grr! I'm scary, time to go back and stay in your burrows".

Some people tried to floor it, thinking they could still manage their escape. Unfortunately, in their hasty actions, they failed to notice the ten foot deep paw print that lay ahead of them. Vehicles crashed head first into the pit the Hyena had made. Before they could even attempt climbing out, the female slammed back down, mushing them to paste. Predictably, the majority of the humans who hadn't been killed by the onslaught, turned around and raced back to the city. The Hyena was once again pleased with how easy it was to manipulate these dumb creatures. She was also happy to see those who tried to traverse her paw print get trapped in them, confirming this path was now blocked for the humans. She made sure to crush any of the survivors still trying to escape. The female didn't want any getting out and attracting other animals to the Hyena's territory. Once she ensured all survivors were killed, she trotted off to destroy the next roadway. Even her paw prints on the countryside between roads were deep enough to make escape impossible for even the best off road vehicles, or even on foot. She had also unknowingly crushed multiple railroad lines, not even feeling the tracks bend out of shape under her paws.

The female continued on her way, ripping up the countryside, stomping out the roadways and scaring the humans back into the city. She always made sure to crush a healthy amount, using them as an example to scare back the other humans. Any stubborn humans that failed to turn around were quickly snuffed out. Does the female run into anything interesting as she lays waste to the cities perimeter?

The female Hyena was quite worn out. She had stomped out countless motorways and crushed an unfathomable amount of fleeing vehicles. She needed a rest, and possibly, a good fuck. The males should just be about done digging the den. The Hyena began to make her way back to the males, stomping through yet another untouched section of city. In her tired state, she was not in the mood to reduce her destructive impact on the humans. She had opted to simply cut through the odd building to shorten her path.

But the females work was not in vain. She had successfully destroyed all the cities escape routes! Many people had attempted escape again after the female moved on to the next motorway. These humans were thwarted once more, as they found the road covered in pawprints much deeper then their entire vehicle. Even traveling within the city itself was becoming more difficult. Any road the female or the other males had trotted on within the city was turned into a crater-y mess, and was completely undrivable. This sealed the fate of the humans, as escape was now impossible! Her work had also unknowingly knocked down all communication lines, so their was no way for the city to call for help.

Night was just about approaching. To the females surprise, she noticed the human structures were glowing. "Probably using some kind of bioluminescence", she thought. The female did appreciate how this made it easier to navigate paths. Although it was annoying how the lights went out so easily once she stomped on them. After once again reducing the amount of untouched city, the female finally arrived back where she had left the males. Only a large clothing store stood in her way, which she lazily plowed through. The Hyena was too tired to find a way around at this point! Their was of course no harm in creating a few shortcuts. Looking forward the female could see the finished product of the males work.

The area had been devastated. Entire chunks of skyscraper had been sent crashing into other buildings. Hundreds of tons of debris had been flung, burying massive parts of the city. Tens of thousands of people ended up being killed, and many more were injured. Despite the damage to the local human ecology, the female was quite happy with the males work! The den consisted of a large opening in the ground. Inside, the males had hollowed out a small cave like structure, which was more then enough room for the entire clan to fit. Roughly a full city block was wiped out to create the entrance. Many of the once tall 100 story buildings were leveled to make room. The buildings that stood on the surface of the hollowed out area were mostly intact, only sustaining various cracks and fissures. However, the males digging had also unknowingly severed various underground water, electricity, phone and internet lines, which cut off those utilities for large chunks of the city. This further made life more unpleasant for the humans populous.

The clan lined up, ready to greet each other in the traditional Hyena fashion. The female, still standing in the ruins of the clothing store, raised a hind leg. The morning sun rose over the city. It's warm rays shined onto the buildings, waking up the terrified humans within. The citizens had barely slept, many of them trying in vain to call for help outside the city or had been driving around all night to try and find an intact road to escape. Eventually all the humans realized their plans had been thwarted by the clever female Hyena. All they could do now is take shelter in various buildings and pray they would be safe.

The sunlight eventually made its way into the Hyena's den. The female was the first to wake. She walked out and stood in what was once a main intersection of the city. She let out a whoop, which woke the three males. They quickly exited the den and joined the female outside. They were excited for another fun day! Still groggy, the males let out various stretches and yawns. One male stretched out in the typical canine fashion, letting his front legs rest flat onto the ground. His behind was also stretched outwards, right up against a nearby building! The humans inside screamed as his fluffy butt smashed into the side of their apartment building. People living on that side of the structure were instantly crushed. The Hyena stretched out further, destroying more units as he dug in deeper. Even his musky testicles caused destruction, as each one smash through the lower floors as if they were wrecking balls! With half the building caved in, the Hyena pulled back from his stretch. The damage was too great, the building moaned and collapsed, killing any survivors that the Hyena had not smothered. He wasn't even aware of the destruction and deaths he had caused, he was too focused on the nice feeling of stretching.

The Matriarch on the other hand had definitely taken notice. She yelped as she observed the building collapse. "What a shame, another hive of tasty humans lost", she thought to herself. She then decided now would be the perfect time to lay down the new rules to her clan about keeping the damage to the humans at a minimum. Otherwise, knowing the males rowdy antics, the city would be wiped out before the days end!

With a whoop, she told the males to line up. The three males immediately stopped what they were doing and submissively sat in front of the female. With a series of whoops, grunts, snarls and whines, the female roughly communicated her new orders about not letting humans go to waste, to ensure they have a healthy stock to fill their bellies. The males would have to now only walk on the paths (roads) instead of plowing through blocks of city. They would also need to scare the humans out of the buildings to feed on them, not tear the whole thing down. The female figured the more of the hives they left in tact, the faster the humans would repopulate. She then gave a quick example of this, the female walked up to a nearby untouched building and rested her foreleg on it. She rubbed the top of the building, causing the entire thing to sway. Cracks formed and windows shattered all along the structure. The people inside had no choice but to evacuate, as they feared the building was going to crumble ontop of them. The female simply smirked as predictably, humans started to flee outside the entrance. She simply lapped up the group of people and swallowed them whole. She then removed her paw, saving the building and the remaining humans inside for later. The males observed her intently, taking the new information in.

info.brief_description: Portals bring forth giant animals to the world.
info.description:
Portals open up on a distant world populated by giant animals. Curious giants enter such portals to find themselves on a planet of a smaller scale...

Rules...

This story is from a third person perspective - He/She/They. Not first (I) or second (You) perspectives.

No giant humans.

Any giant animal of any species, real, extinct, mythological or fictional.

Any body type Feral, Anthro or even Taurs.

Height can vary from a few hundred feet to five thousand feet. However, the size scale needs to stay the same for a storyline.
Unless of course there is a 'normal' size difference A 3ft Feral Wolf to a 8ft anthro Lion. But no 200ft Wolves with a 2500ft one in
the same storyline!

The giant Anthros & Taurs can be from any time period/culture.

Feral animals maybe either wild, pet/companions for the anthros/Taurs or sentient.
Pets/companions may have collars, harnesses saddles etc. Whilst wild of course won't have anything artificial.

Language - For simplicity all characters 'speak' English. Though in reality the giants have their own languages it will
be difficult to make up several new languages. Humans won't understand a giant and vice versa though to us they would both
be talking clear English

The 'small' planet is basically modern Earth with humans but it's not Earth Itself.

Real places, landmarks, buildings etc. Can be used as a reference in the story though.

New portals may open up to remove/add giants, for some reason humans can't be transported through the portals.

The story can change to follow a new giant instead, but try to leave an option to still follow the previous giant.

Any theme allowed. The giants can be harmed/ killed by each other or by humans, they aren't invincible!

Oh and 'attack' isn't always accurate. The giants could be friendly or curious but a 500ft tall giant is going to cause some damage even if it's unintentional.
